attributes.action: Introduce Proportional Representation for UK Elections
attributes.additional_details: The UK’s First Past the Post system is unfair - millions of votes don’t count, and smaller parties are ignored. Proportional Representation would make every vote matter and reflect people’s real choices. Countries like Germany and New Zealand use PR successfully, creating fairer, more cooperative governments. The UK should modernise its democracy so Parliament truly represents the people’s voice.
attributes.background: I want the UK Government to replace the First Past the Post voting system with Proportional Representation, so every vote counts equally and seats in Parliament fairly reflect how people vote.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign the following petitions, which call for similar action:

Use Proportional Representation at the next General Election
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/728017

Hold a referendum on replacing First Past the Post with proportional voting
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/734192
